Title: SR-5912 WebPG2 Graphics Performance Cont.
Description:
The performance (i.e., graphics call up time, client memory and CPU usage, ) of the Web PG2 solution needs to be validated on real-life complex graphics with subscription to simulated values.
Current performance expectation based on email from Carsten from 5.1.2022 is:

“Process graphics (more details in process graphic requirements):
For all means, the ThinClient shall show a display faster than a real client of the core system.
Definition
Graphics elements:
Graphics elements are non-interactive, rudimentary primitives displayed on a screen such as lines, circles, arcs, rectangles, etc. . Several elements can be combined together to create a complex image.
Variables:
Variables are single changing values such as one analog or binary value with no status indication.
Symbol:
A symbol is a combination out of graphic elements that form a shape and variables that are connected to a graphic element changing dynamically graphic elements, e.g. a analog value object that show the object and the status of the analog value, a pump that indicates running/stop condition.
Requirement to graphics:
It shall be possible to have the update interval for live data of 1 s. Lower update rate might be acceptable for the selected use cases.
Call up time for the graphic display with 50 symbols with each 3 dynamic elements shall be <1s
Call up times for graphic displays with 200 symbols with each 3 dynamic elements shall be <= 2s.

Display update cycle time down to 1 s configurable by display“


Involvement:
- Sierra
   - Subscriptions are cached/prepared by the WebPG2 backend from the moment when a client requests a graphic

Title: OPC UA Library Redundancy | Handle failover
Description:
Requirements:

•We should support none, cold, warm and hot redundancy
•Redundancy mode should be configurable
•Failover should be based on; connection failure & major drop in ServiceLevel - make sure that it is efficient to look for ServiceLevel in "OnDataChange"-events.

Not included:

•Failover time requirement?
•Handle changed redundancy settings without a restart?

More info in powerpoint attached to the epic.
Useful additional information:

Non-Transparent redundancy is what to be supported =
no help from OPC UA Server side except ServiceLevel (health value).

Different redundancy modes are defined in OPC UA:
None:
No redundancy support

Cold:
Classic Active/standby pattern

Warm:
Connect to both servers, subscribe to both, only
”activate sampling to one”.

Hot:
Connect to both servers, subscribe to both,
activate sampling to both.
Note: Dont publish from slave

HotAndMirrored:
Not applicable for us


UA Part 4: Services - 6.6.2 Server Redundancy (opcfoundation.org)

Title: OPC UA Redundancy
Description:
++++---Q<<The WebPG2 component has to support redundancy. 
  • DNS redundancy will be used for a switchover between the client and the web server. 
  • On the backend-side the OPC UA Client needs to be able to switch between two OPC UA Servers. It is possible that a set of OPC UA Servers can be provided instead of only 1 URL. Alternatively, some other redundancy mechanism defined by the OPC UA Standard can be used as long as it will work with UA Servers available in 800xA 6.2 and S+ Yoda 2/3.
  • For network redundancy RNRP can be used in case Web servers run on nodes with RNRP installed (which it should not be if running on a windows server cluster?).

Breakdown:
Architecture work

Redundancy modes to support:
  • ++ServiceLevel is however not supported and cannot be used effectively in the selection of server.
  • The client should support Warm, Hot(a) and Hot(b) redundancy behavior.
    The different modes would be a tradeoff between, failover time and load on the servers and possibly underlying devices (depending on settings in 800x, to make most out of parallel subscriptions to 800xA the OPC UA Servers should have affinity to different connectivity servers). 
Identify criteria when to switch
Keep-Alive mechanism on the subscription is used to determine if the client should switch to another server.

Non functional requirements
Switch over time:
  • Should we aim for 1-3 seconds? For the lower value Hot(b) would probably be required. Hot(b) is what is implemented in 800xA OPC DA Handler.

Title: SR-5911 Workplace navigation using Tree view
Description:
Background: 

The NGT Workplace is expected to support split view (two content windows arranged vertically) and non-split view (having only content window) having left side dedicatedly displaying PG2 graphic. 

In split view, the left side is always displays the PG2 graphics that is intent to have navigation buttons and few main parameters displayed w.r.t process, whereas the right side view is meant to display the any HMI contents such as Alarm List, Trend, Process graphics (PG2), Diagnostic (If available), and Help. In this view, no hamburger menu based tree navigation mechanism expected. All navigation is expected from split view based left side navigation graphic.

In non-split view, only one content area with ability to view any HMI content is expected. The HMI contents such as Alarm List, Trend, Process graphics (PG2), Diagnostic (If available), and Help shall be viewed. For main navigation purposes, it is expected to have hamburger menu based tree navigation structure that is preferably inherited from System 800xA's structure.

Scope/Narrative:

The Thin Client shall provide possibility to display a flyout navigation hierarchy structure instead of a split view based PG2 navigation process graphic. The flyout shall have a fixed width. Commands executed from the navigation shall open views (PG2, Alarm List, and Trends) in the main pane (by replacing currently viewed content) or depending on the configuration it might be possible to open views in an overlay (e.g., online help). 

The flyout navigation shall be based on the latest version of PCP Common HMI framework. The look and feel shall be according to #54839. 

The flyout shall support at least 1 level of nesting. The contents of the flyout menu can be initially loaded from a static JSON file and the format of the configuration is documented in the #59164.  However, it shall be part of workplace configuration which is based on the object model proposed by Operations Architect team and agreed with System 800xA.

Note: The Tree data shall be deployed by System 800xA in agreed object model as part of workplace configuration

Each item of the tree menu shall be defined to have its own ICON that is static in nature and such ICONs shall follow the NGT Style.

Note: Tree menu will not show any dynamic information (e.g., alarm metrics such as number of alarms in a specific area)

Title: SR-5887 WebPG2 Faceplate support
Description:
The Web PG2 component is extended to support the visualization of 800xA Faceplates that were migrated from the Faceplate Framework to the PG2 format. 

Functionality needed  in order to replace the Faceplate framework.
  • Input elements
    • Input element will be provided as part of the graphics epic. Any missing element?
  • Support for DynamicTab & DynamicElement in the system where the deploy is made.
    • OnTopOfTabs event when faceplate element is "active" is supported by Dynamic tab, a concept that is used by some libraries for todays faceplate framework.
  • Builder/GDI support for element references
    • Make it possible to handle element references as data entities in Graphics Builder (show) and GDI (create). Only possibility today is using LateBoundElementReference and LateBoundElementReferenceArray functions using aspect keys.
  • Support brownfield faceplate elements (note IOTAS had its own aspect type) in deploy.
    • Deploy of faceplate elements, faceplate...
    • Support Faceplate "displays" in Graphics Server
    • Create Aspect type for Faceplate Aspect Type for the faceplate "display".
______________________________

Migrated faceplates to new aspects
  • new aspectId
  • new Aspect Category List

This affects navigation to a specific aspect (aspect references) (needs to be replaced with references to new faceplates).
Default navigation is typically set to show faceplate if it exists (controlled via Precedence List).

Description:

Components shall provide the capability to mitigate the effects of information and/or message flooding types of DoS events.

Assessment comment:
2/15/2021: Implement rate limiting so that full functionality is possible from some clients. The well-behaving clients may not be limited.

Interface to xA and S+ has to handle its own robustness in case a web server gets compromised (e.g., a DSAC on OPC UA Servers). NGT Engineering will have to implement the same rate limiting for their Engineering web services.

Title: IEC 62443-4-2 - 5.1 CR: Network segmentation
Description:
FR 5 - Restricted data flow (RDF)

2/8/2021: We need to ensure that any protocol that we use goes through a firewall. Data diod is not required in the first release. Reverse connect support is needed to avoid inbound connections.

Title: IEC 62443-4-2 - 3.13 HDR: Provisioning asset owner roots of trust
Description:
FR 3 - System integrity (SI)
Host devices shall
a) provide the capability to provision and protect the confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of asset owner keys and data to be used as “roots of trust”; and
b) support the capability to provision without reliance on components that may be outside of the device’s security zone.

Assessment comment:
2/8/2021: Certificate handling must be based on root of trust. We shall rely on Windows certificate store that will fulfill this for us. NEEDS MORE CLARIFICATION. There might be an impact on NGT Engineering as they will have to distribute the trust roots.

Title: IEC 62443-4-2 - 2.11.2 CR RE: Protection of time source integrity
Description:
FR 2 - Use Control (UC)
The time synchronization mechanism shall provide the capability to detect unauthorized alteration and cause an audit event upon alteration.

Assessment comment:
Responsibility of the system stream to sync time.
1.2.2021: NTP is not a secure protocol for time sync. Customers asking for this. Need to agree with System how time sync will be handled. In 800xA there are some functions that ensure that Windows time is up-to-date. We aim to rely on system time. How will a web server be synchronized if it is not in the same network. IEC 61588 standard (used in Power) is likely sucessor of NTP. Tomas wants us to plan for this. We do not need to implement everything.

Title: NGT Faceplates | NFR | LOOX Faceplate Performance
Description:
This requirement describes the non-functional requirement of the LOOX faceplates which are as follows,

Faceplate update rate: On exception and below 200ms
Faceplate Launching: Less than a second
Faceplate View Switching incl tab change: Less than a second
Faceplate Round-trip time (command propagation to controller and feedback to faceplate) : Less 300ms.

Acceptance Criteria:
Performance expectations are met, tested and results are consistent.

Title: NGT Faceplates | Loox Faceplates compatibility
Description:
1LOOX Based faceplates coming from S+ Operations shall be compatible in NGT HMI without need of any conversion tool. There shall no difference between runtime version of Native LOOX rendered faceplate and LOOX Web Assembly rendered faceplate. All the functionalities supported by Native LOOX for faceplate support shall be made available for LOOX Web Assembly as well that including,
  • indications
  • script methods
  • command methods
  • System setting supports
  • Dynamic diagram types
  • WVP (Windows View Port) management for different views of faceplates
  • Layer management
  • Two/One Step Operations Management
Any System settings, XML files that are required to make the faceplate run in the NGT HMI shall be migrated by engineering tool automatically without any manual steps.

Acceptance Criteria:
LOOX faceplates are compatible and rendered with no different in comparison with Native LOOX, results are consistent.

Title: Structure Name Service
Description: Structure Name server  functionality is required by many software components in the system such as Process Graphics, Workplace, trend, Alarm and Event.

Title: Web PG2 Performance Subscription/Loading Improvements
Description:
The subscription can be pre-subscribed by the back-end wo. having to pass the client logic.
Improvements in the serialization of data.

Title: Web PG2 Access Rights
Description:
In Graphics it should be possible to dim the UI or indicate in other ways if the user is allowed to modify a value or not based on the current permission settings.

Note:
In OPC UA an attribute specified if the user is allowed to Read/Write the attribute.
In 800xA a quality bit (proprietary) is used to indicate if a property is user writable by current user. 
In Wasabi/IoTAS this is not implemented.

Title: NGT ThinClient | Pop-up windows handling
Description:
Background: Faceplates are used by the operator and supervisors to monitor, interact, and control plant devices that are part of a process. Typically each plant devices is identified by a Id which is also known as Tag or Object name, such devices in a system consist of information that used for its monitoring and control it. In general faceplates provides a capability to operator to interact, control, and supervise the associated devices. Typically faceplates of an object can be launched by,
  • Click on graphical element in a graphic.
  • Click on hot-spot in a display
  • Click on Control/Faceplate option in Context that might be invoked from graphic, trend, alarm list, and event list.
In general, faceplates share common attributes with respect to their design and operation. However, depending upon their object type, and control application they belong to defines the functionality provided within the faceplate to meet their operational needs.

Scope: This features is expected to design and development of an overlay for faceplate support. It is expected that an overlay as faceplate shall be launched for an object location in a PG2 graphics, trend, and alarm list. The faceplate overlay shall provide following functionalities,
  1. It shall be possible to launch faceplates with pinned mode which the overlay window is not closed even after losing mouse focus, in other words always on top.
  2. It shall be provide an header to indicate pin status, and it shall be also provide a button to close the overlay.
  3. The size and position management shall be part of API modeling. However, they shall be static in nature and it is acceptable if its not user configurable.
Note: Any scope that is not described in the scope section are considered to be out of scope of this feature.

Scope Adjustments:
Poke page with possibilities to launch PG2 graphic, trend, and alarm list instead of launching it from an object located in a PG2 graphic.
